summary: Navy sailors maintain the ships that are needed to keep the U.S. safe and the seas open for world commerce. But the Navy faces a range of challenges that hinder sailors' ability to complete maintenance work: There aren't always enough sailors available—and the Navy doesn't track and report data that could help it better oversee personnel assignments Newer sailors might not be fully prepared for...
title: Navy Readiness: Actions Needed to Improve Support for Sailor-Led Maintenance
